page.title: 18CHURCHES:HOPTON BENEFICE
page.content: The churches of Barningham,Coney Weston & Market Weston form this benefice under the Rector of Hopton. Market Weston & Coney Weston churches lie out- side the villages, the former a land- mark across open fileds.Barningham is in the centre of the older part of the village,some distance from new housing developments.The churches have to share services in rotation.Communion,Morning & Evening prayer are held at 8, 9.30, 11 & 6 (6.30) with Evening prayer at Coney Weston at 3 in winter as there is no eletricity. Anglicans & Method- ists hold regular united services in Barningham. Congregations there have increased & there is a good Sunday School.The churches & churchyards are tended by volunteers.The churches are no longer the centre of village life yet many,not attending themselves would be shocked if they closed.
